diseases.description: List of disease(s) been diagnosed to the individual, defined by disease ontology ID(s), age of onset, stage and the presence of family history.

items.description: Diseases diagnosed e.g. to an individual, defined by diseaseID, age of onset, stage, level of severity, outcome and the presence of family history. Similarities to GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `Disease`

ageOfOnset.$comments: If using an ontology class the use of NCIT Age Group ontology term (NCIT:C20587) descendants is recommended.
ageOfOnset.description: Definition of a wrapper for various time descriptors. This follows the Phenopackets structure https://github.com/phenopackets/phenopacket-schema/blob/v2/docs/time-element.rst

oneOf.description: Age value definition. Provenance: GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `Age`

iso8601duration.description: Represents age as a ISO8601 duration (e.g., P40Y10M05D).

iso8601duration.description: Represents age as a ISO8601 duration (e.g., P40Y10M05D).

start.title: Age

oneOf.title: AgeRange

oneOf.description: Gestational age (or menstrual age) is the time elapsed between the first day of the last normal menstrual period and the day of delivery. The first day of the last menstrual period occurs approximately 2 weeks before ovulation and approximately 3 weeks before implantation of the blastocyst. Because most women know when their last period began but not when ovulation occurred, this definition traditionally has been used when estimating the expected date of delivery. In contrast, chronological age (or postnatal age) is the time elapsed after birth. Provenance: Phenopackets v2

days.description: Days beyond the completed weeks, if available.

weeks.description: Completed weeks of gestation according to the above definition.

oneOf.title: GestationalAge

oneOf.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.
Time interval with start and end defined as ISO8601 time stamps.

end.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.

start.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.

oneOf.title: TimeInterval

info.description: Placeholder to allow the Beacon to return any additional information that is necessary or could be of interest in relation to the query or the entry returned. It is recommended to encapsulate additional informations in this attribute instead of directly adding attributes at the same level than the others in order to avoid collision in the names of attributes in future versions of the specification.

items.title: Procedure

karyotypicSex.description: The chromosomal sex of an individual represented from a selection of options. The values correspond to the ordinal values in the Phenopackets schema where: 0 - UNKNOWN_KARYOTYPE (Untyped or inconclusive karyotyping); 1 - XX (Female); 2 - XY (Male); 3 - XO (Single X chromosome only); 4 - XXY (Two X and one Y chromosome); 5 - XXX (Three X chromosomes); 6 - XXYY (Two X chromosomes and two Y chromosomes); 7 - XXXY (Three X chromosomes and one Y chromosome); 8 - XXXX (Four X chromosomes); 9 - XYY (One X and two Y chromosomes); 10 - OTHER_KARYOTYPE (None of the above types)

affected.description: Is the individual affected by the disease in the pedigree?

memberId.description: Identifier of the individual. The individual could be part of the same Beacon datasets or not, in which case the information here is meant to complete the pedigree. If the individual is also in the dataset use that Individual ID. If it is not the in the dataset, use a non-collading ID, e.g. concatenating the Pedigree ID with a local ID, similarly to the example 'Pedigree1001-m1'.

disease.title: Disease

id.description: Pedigree identifier.

members.description: List of members of the pedigree. If the current pedigree definition is attached to the proband, it contains the whole list of pedigree members, including the proband. If the definition is attached to an individual different than the proband, it only contains two entries: one that describes that member, e.g. the proband mother or father, and one that points to the proband.

affected.description: Is the individual affected by the disease in the pedigree?

memberId.description: Identifier of the individual. The individual could be part of the same Beacon datasets or not, in which case the information here is meant to complete the pedigree. If the individual is also in the dataset use that Individual ID. If it is not the in the dataset, use a non-collading ID, e.g. concatenating the Pedigree ID with a local ID, similarly to the example 'Pedigree1001-m1'.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

numSubjects.description: Total number of subjects in pedigree.

items.title: Pedigree

items.description: Used to describe a phenotype that characterizes the subject or biosample.

reference.description: Definition of an external reference class. Provenance: GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `ExternalReference`

id.description: An application specific identifier. RECOMMENDED.

notes.description: An optional text descriptor. Renamed compared to GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `ExternalReference.description`
notes.example: Signatures of Discriminative Copy Number Aberrations in 31 Cancer Subtypes

reference.title: ExternalReference

evidence.title: Evidence

excluded.description: (from Phenopackets v.2) Flag to indicate whether the disease was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the disease was observed. Therefore it is only required in cases to indicate that the disease was looked for, but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the 'featureType' field. CAUTION It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the disease!

CURIE.description: A CURIE identifier for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

modifiers.description: For instance one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. [ HPO:probinson ]

iso8601duration.description: Represents age as a ISO8601 duration (e.g., P40Y10M05D).

start.title: Age

oneOf.title: AgeRange

oneOf.description: Gestational age (or menstrual age) is the time elapsed between the first day of the last normal menstrual period and the day of delivery. The first day of the last menstrual period occurs approximately 2 weeks before ovulation and approximately 3 weeks before implantation of the blastocyst. Because most women know when their last period began but not when ovulation occurred, this definition traditionally has been used when estimating the expected date of delivery. In contrast, chronological age (or postnatal age) is the time elapsed after birth. Provenance: Phenopackets v2

days.description: Days beyond the completed weeks, if available.

weeks.description: Completed weeks of gestation according to the above definition.

oneOf.title: GestationalAge

cumulativeDose.title: Quantity

items.description: This element represents a block of time in which the dosage of a medication was constant. For example, to represent a period of 30 mg twice a day for an interval of 10 days, we would use a Quantity element to represent the individual 30 mg dose, and OntologyClass element to represent twice a day, and an Interval element to represent the 10-day interval. Provenance: Phenopackets v2

interval.description: Time interval with start and end defined as ISO8601 time stamps.
